patterns: does the virus stick to packaged food?
does it spread on food packaging?
Can the virus that causes COVID-19 be spread through food, including refrigerated or frozen food?
do I need to wash my groceries?
spread via food
responses: There is no evidence for transmission of coronavirus associated with food, it is thought that food can be contaminated with the respiratory droplets of infected persons. So, it is always advisable to follow food safety tips while buying groceries from the markets or getting delivered to home.
Yes it can spread in case an infected person contaminates it with virus droplets

patterns: Can you have corona virus and still test negative?

Negative test results

Can a person test negative and later test positive for COVID-19?
Considerations for receiving negative test results
responses: A negative result means it’s likely you are not infectious, But a negative test is not a guarantee you do not have COVID-19 and there’s still a chance you may be infectious.

patterns: Why the name

Why is the disease being called coronavirus disease 2019, COVID-19?

What is coronavirus
give me information of virus
responses: The World Health Organization (WHO) has decided to name the disease caused by the novel coronavirus "COVID-19" and refers to the virus that causes it as the "COVID-19 virus."
COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) is a disease caused by a virus named SARS-CoV-2 and was discovered in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.

patterns: covid risk in children
does children get covid
how risky is covid for children and babies
Are children at higher risk of getting sick?
Can corona virus infect an infant?
Are kids at increased risk of infection?
responses: Most of the cases of COVID-19 in children are mild disease like other viral infections. But there is a high probability, it can be fatal in children with underlying chronic diseases like heart disease, liver diseases, kidney diseases, malnutrition and children with immune deficiency.

While children are as likely to get COVID-19 as adults, kids are less likely to become severely ill. Up to 50% of children and adolescents might have COVID-19 with no symptoms. However, some children with COVID-19 need to be hospitalized, treated in the intensive care unit or placed on a ventilator to help them breathe.

patterns: How to prevent covid 19
How to ensure safety against covid 19
How can i prevent the spread of covid 19
How to safeguard against covid 19
safety measures against covid
responses:
To prevent the spread of COVID-19:
Maintain a safe distance from others (at least 1 metre), even if they don’t appear to be sick.
Wear a mask in public, especially indoors or when physical distancing is not possible.
Choose open, well-ventilated spaces over closed ones. Open a window if indoors.
Clean your hands often. Use soap and water, or an alcohol-based hand rub.
Get vaccinated when it’s your turn. Follow local guidance about vaccination.
Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or a tissue when you cough or sneeze.
Stay home if you feel unwell.

patterns: How long can the virus survive in environment
How long virus survives
how long virus survives on surfaces
responses: It is not certain how long the virus that causes COVID-19 survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other corona viruses. Studies suggest that corona viruses (including preliminary information on the COVID-19 virus) may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days.

After being expelled from the body, coronaviruses can survive on surfaces for hours to days. If a person touches the dirty surface, they may deposit the virus at the eyes, nose, or mouth where it can enter the body and cause infection.

Signs and Symptoms of Covid-19

responses:
Most common symptoms:
fever
cough
tiredness
loss of taste or smell
Less common symptoms:
sore throat
headache
aches and pains
diarrhoea
a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes
red or irritated eyes
Serious symptoms:
difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
loss of speech or mobility, or confusion
chest pain

Inability to keep down any liquids
New confusion or inability to awaken
Bluish lips

patterns: What are the various coronavirus test
Which test should i go for
Which is the best test for covid
what is RT-PCR test and antigen test
responses:
The FDA approved these types of tests for diagnosing a COVID-19 infection:

RT-PCR test. Also called a molecular test, this COVID-19 test detects genetic material of the virus using a lab technique called reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (PCR). A fluid sample is collected with a nasal swab or a throat swab, or you may spit into a tube to produce a saliva sample.

Results may be available in minutes if analyzed onsite or a few days — or longer in locations with test processing delays — if sent to an outside lab. RT-PCR tests are very accurate when properly performed by a health care professional, but the rapid test can miss some cases.

Antigen test. This COVID-19 test detects certain proteins in the virus. Using a nasal swab to get a fluid sample, antigen tests can produce results in minutes. Others may be sent to a lab for analysis.

A positive antigen test result is considered accurate when instructions are carefully followed. But there's an increased chance of false-negative results — meaning it's possible to be infected with the virus but have a negative result. Depending on the situation, the health care provider may recommend a RT-PCR test to confirm a negative antigen test result.

patterns: how long it takes the corona virus to show symptoms
what is incubation period of virus
How long should i isolate myself
How long covid 19 takes to show symptoms
responses: The incubation period means the time between catching the virus and beginning to have symptoms of the disease. Most estimates of the incubation period for COVID-19 range from 1-14 days, most commonly around five days.

patterns: What is long Covid
What is my risk of having long COVID-19 if I become infected
does being vaccinated prevent long covid
How to prevent long covid
responses:
What is a post-COVID-19 condition?
In some people with COVID-19, symptoms persist for weeks or even months after recovering from the acute illness. This is referred to as ‘post-COVID-19 condition’, sometimes described as ‘long COVID’.
The researchers found that vaccination seemed to reduce the likelihood of long COVID in people who had been infected by only about 15%.

patterns: what are covid 19 vaccines
what vaccine are available for Covid
which vaccine should i go for
Can vaccine prevent covid
Which vaccine are available
responses:
Getting vaccinated could save your life. COVID-19 vaccines provide strong protection against serious illness, hospitalization and death. There is also some evidence that being vaccinated will make it less likely that you will pass the virus on to others, which means your decision to get the vaccine also protects those around you.


The vaccines available in India are : 1. COVAXIN      2.COVISHIELD     3.COVISHIELD      4.COVOVAX      5.ZyCoV-D

patterns: Is there any side effects of taking vaccine
Are vaccines safe
How safe are these vaccines
responses:
Like with any vaccine, some people will experience mild to moderate side effects after being vaccinated against COVID-19. This is a normal sign that the body is developing protection. Side effects to COVID-19 vaccines include a fever, tiredness, headache, muscle ache, chills, diarrhoea and pain or redness at the injection site.
These vaccines are available
The Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty vaccine, 31 December 2020.
The SII/COVISHIELD and AstraZeneca/AZD1222 vaccines, 16 February 2021.
The Janssen/Ad26.COV 2.S vaccine developed by Johnson & Johnson, 12 March 2021.
The Moderna COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA 1273), 30 April 2021.
The Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine, 7 May 2021.
The Sinovac-CoronaVac vaccine, 1 June 2021.
The Bharat Biotech BBV152 COVAXIN vaccine, 3 November 2021. 
The Covovax (NVX-CoV2373) vaccine, 17 December 2021.
The Nuvaxovid (NVX-CoV2373) vaccine, 20 December 2021

patterns: Where can i get vaccine from
How to get vaccine
where is vaccine available
how can i get vaccine for corona virus
responses:
Vaccines are available from Government and Private Health Facilities as notified, known as COVID Vaccination Centres (CVCs).
Online registration and appointment can be done through Co-WIN portal.

From one mobile phone number, one can register 4 people, however, each person will need their own photo identification document.
Through the portal, you can find out the list of available CVCs and dates and time of available vaccination slots, to book an appointment as per your choice. You will need an OTP verification prior to registration and a confirmation slip/token will be generated after registration. You will also get a confirmatory sms later.

Those who cannot get themselves registered online can contact their local Government health workers, who will help the beneficiaries to the Government CVC for on the spot registration, appointment, verification and vaccination on the same day.

Vaccines are available from Government and Private Health Facilities as notified, known as COVID Vaccination Centres (CVCs),
Through the portal, you can find out the list of available CVCs and dates and time of available vaccination slots, to book an appointment as per your choice. You will need an OTP verification prior to registration and a confirmation slip/token will be generated after registration. You will also get a confirmatory sms later.
Those who cannot get themselves registered online can contact their local Government health workers, who will help the beneficiaries to the Government CVC for on the spot registration, appointment, verification and vaccination on the same day.

patterns: Treatment of corona in hospital using medicines
How to treat severe cases of corona virus
what steps are needed to recover from severe covid 19
How to recover from severe case of covid 19
what treatment is there for dangerous case of covid
how to treat coronavirus in hospitals
medicines to treat severe cases of coronavirus
what medicines are there to treat coronavirus
responses: The FDA has granted emergency-use authorization for two prescription antiviral treatments administered orally as pills: Paxlovid (nirmatrelvir tablets and ritonavir tablets) by Pfizer and Lagevrio (molnupiravir) by Merck. These treatments work differently but are both used outside of a hospital setting and in individuals who have tested positive for COVID-19 and are at high risk for COVID-19 complications.

Remdesivir (Veklury), the antiviral infusion medication that doctors have used to treat hospitalized COVID-19 patients since early in the pandemic, is now an option for people recovering from COVID-19 at home.

In 2022, the FDA expanded eligibility for remdesivir to adults, children, and babies with mild or moderate COVID-19 who are at high risk of severe illness.
Healthcare providers administer remdesivir with an IV in sessions that take place over three consecutive days, requiring patients to make repeat visits to a hospital or outpatient clinic.

patterns: How to treat covid at home
treatment of corona at home
what steps are needed to recover from mild to moderate covid 19
How to recover from mild case of covid 19
what treatment is there for mild and moderate case of covid
how to treat coronavirus at home
methods to treat mild case of coronavirus
what natural methods are there to treat coronavirus
responses:
Natural Remedies for COVID-19 Symptoms
The following strategies can be part of an overall treatment plan.
Shortness of breath: If being short of breath makes you anxious, your doctor may advise breathing exercises that can help, perform a simple breathing technique to help with COVID-19-related stress.
Cough: For help managing a cough, try cough drops, Vicks VapoRub, and hot water or hot tea with lemon.
Dehydration : To reduce the risk of dehydration, drink fluids regularly and keep eating. Aim for at least 2 liters of water every day. If you are sweating a lot from a fever, you may want to supplement water with an electrolyte-containing sports drink, such as Gatorade, according to Geisinger Health System.
Eating issues : To make eating easier, opt for foods that are easy to digest and relatively bland, such as chicken noodle or vegetable broth soup, avocados, or toast. While loss of taste and smell can make food unappetizing, good nutrition will aid your recovery.

Along with taking home remedies such as Vicks Vaporub and soups
Over the counter medicines can help like acetaminophen (Tylenol), naproxen (Aleve), or ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) for Fever, body aches, or headache
